title: 18 Best Lumbar Pillows for Boosting Your Back and Bed-Scape (2025)
description: These elongated cushions go the extra mile to boost your design scheme
author: Audrey Lee, Blake Bakkila
excerpt: These long cushions go the extra mile to elevate your design scheme, delivering style and back support in equal measure. Here, some of our favorite picks
text: All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.As far as we’re concerned, the best lumbar pillows are the unsung heroes in the world of cushions. They’ve appeared throughout homes featured in AD’s archives—from supermodel Paloma Elsesser’s Brooklyn haven to a classically decorated Southern charmer—and fit perfectly on beds and sofas.As the name suggests, their slim design is optimal for lower back support, but we also think they have enough visual appeal to take your pillow arrangement to the next level. (We certainly know a thing or two about an attractive bed setup.) Characterized by their elongated shape, lumbar pillows come in a few notable styles—cylindrical, skinny angular cushions, and classic rectangular shams. And while this list doesn’t focus on purely ergonomic designs that tackle serious issues like sciatica and promote pressure relief, you will find that these back cushions bring in an element of color and texture to your decor scheme. We also like that the brand carries the same design in a square silhouette so you can mix and match while maintaining cohesion. Plus, it gets bonus points because it’s a machine-washable cover (a rarity for throw pillows!).Best Subtle, Subdued ColorQuince European Linen Oversized Lumbar Pillow CoverIf your goal is a simple hint of color, you can’t go wrong with this style-agnostic design. These pillows are made from the same linen as Quince’s best-selling sheets, so you know you’re in for a soft surface. And since they come in some of the same hues, a color-coordinating moment is in the cards.Best Patchwork StyleHeidi Caillier x Joon Loloi Courtney PillowThis patchwork beauty from Joon Loloi, which remixes gingham and vintage-looking floral prints, proves that neutral color palettes don’t have to be boring. Loloi and Magnolia Home. This texture-heavy beige lumbar cushion is a staple for any modern farmhouse, and though there are four colorways, we’re partial to the monochromatic beige.FAQsHow do I style a bed or sofa with lumbar pillows?The best lumbar support pillows are made with memory foam and conform to your body, addressing lower back concerns and providing pain relief—and then there are items simply made for elevating the look of your home. If you’re not worried about tailbone or nerve pain, a design-forward lumbar pillow is often considered the cherry on top of any bed-scape or sectional sofa. In recent years, these low-back styles have become increasingly popular. As Rushda Hakim, founder of New York City firm Rushda Hakim Design, previously told AD, “Throw pillows or shams add the finishing touch, and a large bolster pillow can be a stylish alternative.”Because they offer so much coverage thanks to their generous width, one lumbar pillow could be all you need to complete your bedding concept. For a sectional, you have a bit more room to worth with. Pair one with a coordinating square pillow in each corner, or use it as a standalone decor item on a smaller sofa, loveseat, accent chair, or oversized recliner.
html:
All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.

As far as we’re concerned, the best lumbar pillows are the unsung heroes in the world of cushions. They’ve appeared throughout homes featured in AD’s archives—from supermodel Paloma Elsesser’s Brooklyn haven to a classically decorated Southern charmer—and fit perfectly on beds and sofas.

As the name suggests, their slim design is optimal for lower back support, but we also think they have enough visual appeal to take your pillow arrangement to the next level. (We certainly know a thing or two about an attractive bed setup.) Characterized by their elongated shape, lumbar pillows come in a few notable styles—cylindrical, skinny angular cushions, and classic rectangular shams. And while this list doesn’t focus on purely ergonomic designs that tackle serious issues like sciatica and promote pressure relief, you will find that these back cushions bring in an element of color and texture to your decor scheme. Below, peruse our picks for the best lumbar pillows, no matter if you want to support your lower back or your pillow habit.

Keep in mind that some of these are sets with the pillow insert included, while others deliver the removable cover only.

Our Top Picks for the Best Lumbar Pillows:

  • Best Textured Lumbar Pillow: Parachute Nomad Lumbar Pillow, $89
  • Best Bolster: Lulu and Georgia Amaroso Linen Ruffle Bolster Pillow, $98 $78
  • Best Coastal-Inspired Design: Serena & Lily Bay Stripe Outdoor Pillow Cover, $128 $102
  • Best Subtle, Subdued Color: Quince Linen Oversized Lumbar Pillow, $70
  • Best Patchwork Style: Joon Loloi Courtney Pillow, $49 $44

Best Textured Lumbar Pillow

Parachute Nomad Lumbar Pillow Cover

When we peeked inside Ariel Kaye’s airy bedroom, we weren’t surprised to find the Parachute founder styled her boudoir with one of the brand’s signature lumbar shams. Personally, we like that the Nomad cover can also add depth to a sectional sofa in a similar hue.

Best Bolster

Lulu and Georgia Amaroso Linen Ruffle Bolster Pillow

This ruffled lumbar roll marries childlike stripes with delicate ruffles for an overall whimsical effect. Just imagine how nice it would look perched on a rocking chair in a nursery or propping you up as you lean back into your dining banquette at Sunday brunch.

Best Coastal-Inspired Design

Serena & Lily Bay Stripe Outdoor Pillow Cover

The tassels on these coastal-influenced cushions from Serena & Lily act as an exclamation point on your bed. We also like that the brand carries the same design in a square silhouette so you can mix and match while maintaining cohesion. Plus, it gets bonus points because it’s a machine-washable cover (a rarity for throw pillows!).

Best Subtle, Subdued Color

Quince European Linen Oversized Lumbar Pillow Cover

If your goal is a simple hint of color, you can’t go wrong with this style-agnostic design. These pillows are made from the same linen as Quince’s best-selling sheets, so you know you’re in for a soft surface. And since they come in some of the same hues, a color-coordinating moment is in the cards.

Best Patchwork Style

Heidi Caillier x Joon Loloi Courtney Pillow

This patchwork beauty from Joon Loloi, which remixes gingham and vintage-looking floral prints, proves that neutral color palettes don’t have to be boring. A budget-friendly pick at under $50, it can lean into a quaint cottagecore vibe or muted Shaker-style furniture.

Urban Outfitters Cotton Ruffle Bolster Pillow

The ruffles on this floral-accented pillow throw back to something you might have grown up with in your childhood bedroom. We’re all for leaning into nostalgia, especially with a piece like this that has aged exceptionally well—not too childlike or dated but still very sweet.

Cultiver Collide Bolster Cushion

This extra long bolster made in collaboration with AD-beloved stylist Colin King is a testament to the power of slightly mismatched patterns. The overall effect reminds us of a shibori dye—understated and elegant enough to make the whole room feel slightly more special.

The Citizenry Isidora Lumbar Pillow

Textured lumbar pillows are an excellent way to add dimension to your pillow-scape. This pick from the Citizenry is made of a chunky wool that’s handwoven by a group of master artisans in Uruguay.

Sunday Citizen Snug Lumbar Pillow

Sunday Citizen’s lumbar pillow hits a sweet spot that balances attractive and practical. The pillow’s memory foam filling is a real treat if you’re trying to target lower back pain or prevent slouching.

AllModern Boutique Pixie Decorative Pillow

On the other hand, this graphic pillow screams midcentury modern. We could see it dressing up an Eames lounger or office chair, or it could pair well with a wooden bed frame and some color-matching sheets.

Schoolhouse Polka Dot Pillow

Never underestimate the power of a simple yet surprisingly versatile polka dot. This chic design feels like something plucked out of a Parisian home tour, giving your chamber a je ne sais quoi moment that won’t go out of style anytime soon. It could feel right at home plopped on a home office chair or on a children’s bed.

Coyuchi Organic Relaxed Linen Lumbar Pillow Cover

The exposed seams on this Coyuchi throw pillow cover give it an especially lived-in feel if you’re aiming for a laid-back Mediterranean cottage aesthetic. Let it fly solo or swath your whole bed in the brand’s breathable organic French flax linen (available in regular pillow shams, fitted sheets, and duvet covers) for a relaxed breakfast-in-bed scenario.

Irregular Checkerboard Bolster Pillow By Sarah Sherman Samuel

AD100 designer Sarah Sherman Samuel is a name you can always count on to have fun with fabrics and shapes. This checkerboard bolster pillow looks like if a checkerboard souk rug and a bolster pillow had a baby, combining to a very playful, lighthearted effect.

West Elm Silk Squares Lumbar Pillow Cover

This geometric blue pillow cover reminds us of one we saw in Paloma Elsesser’s very chic Brooklyn apartment. Toss it on a sofa to wake up the entire room.

Hera Store Ikat Velvet Lumbar Pillow

Etsy ranks among our editors’ favorite places to shop for home goods, and this bespoke decor pillow is all we need to prove our point. It can fit in with an already eclectic space or work as a for an otherwise neutral aesthetic.

Article Gabriola Pillow

Bouclé is a practical fabric with staying power. If you want to experiment with the perennial favorite pick, this bouclé lumbar pillow is a chic backrest that comes in two earthy colorways. Use it as an on-trend seat cushion for a built-in bench in a cozy dining room or breakfast nook (or anywhere else you spend long periods of time) for everlasting comfort and style.

Schoolhouse x Clare V. Andre Lumbar Pillow

We’re big fans of any Schoolhouse and Clare V. collaboration, and this curated color pop pillow brings more texture and fun to the table (er, bed).

Loloi x Magnolia Home by Joanna Gaines Liv Pillow

Another noteworthy collab? Loloi and Magnolia Home. This texture-heavy beige lumbar cushion is a staple for any modern farmhouse, and though there are four colorways, we’re partial to the monochromatic beige.

FAQs

How do I style a bed or sofa with lumbar pillows?

The best lumbar support pillows are made with memory foam and conform to your body, addressing lower back concerns and providing pain relief—and then there are items simply made for elevating the look of your home. If you’re not worried about tailbone or nerve pain, a design-forward lumbar pillow is often considered the cherry on top of any bed-scape or sectional sofa. In recent years, these low-back styles have become increasingly popular. As Rushda Hakim, founder of New York City firm Rushda Hakim Design, previously told AD, “Throw pillows or shams add the finishing touch, and a large bolster pillow can be a stylish alternative.”

Because they offer so much coverage thanks to their generous width, one lumbar pillow could be all you need to complete your bedding concept. For a sectional, you have a bit more room to worth with. Pair one with a coordinating square pillow in each corner, or use it as a standalone decor item on a smaller sofa, loveseat, accent chair, or oversized recliner.
